intro: Dillenia nalagi, commonly known as the mountain dillenia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rosaceae family, which includes roses and strawberries, and is characterized by its showy, white to pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a serrated edge, while its fruits are follicles that release seeds when mature. The botanical features of Dillenia nalagi make it an important species in its native ecosystems.
